member.summary: Use this class to customize the Help Page. For example you can set a custom to supply the documentation or you can provide the samples for the requests/responses.

member.summary: This class will generate the samples for the help page.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets CLR types that are used as the content of or .

member.summary: Gets the objects that are used directly as samples for certain actions.

member.summary: Gets the objects that are serialized as samples by the supported formatters.

member.name: P:PivotalERP.Areas.HelpPage.HelpPageSampleGenerator.SampleObjectFactories
member.summary: Gets factories for the objects that the supported formatters will serialize as samples. Processed in order, stopping when the factory successfully returns a non- object.
member.remarks: Collection includes just initially. Use SampleObjectFactories.Insert(0, func) to provide an override and SampleObjectFactories.Add(func) to provide a fallback.

member.summary: Gets the sample object that will be serialized by the formatters. First, it will look at the . If no sample object is found, it will try to create one using (which wraps an ) and other factories in .

member.name: T:PivotalERP.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator
member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:PivotalERP.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: T:PivotalERP.Areas.HelpPage.SampleDirection
member.summary: Indicates whether the sample is used for request or response

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.AllowedSingleIPs
member.summary: Comma seperated string of allowable IPs. Example "10.2.5.41,192.168.0.22"

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.AllowedMaskedIPs
member.summary: Comma seperated string of allowable IPs with masks. Example "10.2.0.0;255.255.0.0,10.3.0.0;255.255.0.0"

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.ConfigurationKeyAllowedSingleIPs
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration key for allowed single IPs
member.value: The configuration key single I ps.

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.ConfigurationKeyAllowedMaskedIPs
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration key allowed mmasked IPs
member.value: The configuration key masked I ps.

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.DeniedSingleIPs
member.summary: Comma seperated string of denied IPs. Example "10.2.5.41,192.168.0.22"

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.DeniedMaskedIPs
member.summary: Comma seperated string of denied IPs with masks. Example "10.2.0.0;255.255.0.0,10.3.0.0;255.255.0.0"

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.ConfigurationKeyDeniedSingleIPs
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration key for denied single IPs
member.value: The configuration key single I ps.

member.name: P:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.ConfigurationKeyDeniedMaskedIPs
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration key for denied masked IPs
member.value: The configuration key masked I ps.

member.name: M:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.SplitAndAddSingleIPs(System.String,Dynamic.BusinessEntity.Security.IpList)
member.summary: Splits the incoming ip string of the format "IP,IP" example "10.2.0.0,10.3.0.0" and adds the result to the IPList

member.name: M:PivotalERP.FilterIpAttribute.SplitAndAddMaskedIPs(System.String,Dynamic.BusinessEntity.Security.IpList)
member.summary: Splits the incoming ip string of the format "IP;MASK,IP;MASK" example "10.2.0.0;255.255.0.0,10.3.0.0;255.255.0.0" and adds the result to the IPList
